org.tinfour.gis.utils

Class ConstraintReaderShapefile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.gis.utils.ConstraintReaderShapefile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ConstraintReaderShapefile
extends Object
implements Closeable
    Provides tools for reading constraints from either a Shapefile

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConstraintReaderShapefile

        public ConstraintReaderShapefile(File file)
                          throws IOException
        Constructs an instance tied to the specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - a valid file reference pointing to a Shapefile.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the specified Shapefile cannot be accessed.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public List<IConstraint> read()
                       throws IOException
        Read constraints from a Shapefile. Values for the Z coordinate will be read from either the Shapefile geometry or from the DBF file if a field name was specified. Application data for the constraints will be either the Shapefile record number, or will be read from the DBF file if an application-data field name was specified.
        Returns:
        a valid, potentially empty list
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of an unrecoverable IO condition.

      • getTotalPointCount

        public int getTotalPointCount()
        Gets the total number of points read from the constraint file; or zero if the content of the constraint file hasn't been read.
        Returns:
        a positive integer.

      • writeConstraintFile

        public static void writeConstraintFile(File file,
                                       List<IConstraint> list)
                                throws IOException
        Writes a text file representing the content of the specified list of constraints
        Parameters:
        file - the output file reference
        list - a valid list of constraints
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O condition

      • writeConstraintFile

        public static void writeConstraintFile(Path path,
                                       List<IConstraint> list)
                                throws IOException
        Writes a text file representing the content of the specified list of constraints
        Parameters:
        path - the path for writing the file
        list - a valid list of constraints
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O condition

      • getCoordinateTransform

        public ICoordinateTransform getCoordinateTransform()
        Gets the coordinate transform associated with this instance. May be null if no coordinate transform was set.
        Returns:
        a valid transform or a null if none was set.

      • setCoordinateTransform

        public void setCoordinateTransform(ICoordinateTransform transform)
        Sets a coordinate transform to be used for mapping values from the source file to vertex coordinates.
        Parameters:
        transform - a valid transform or a null if none is to be applied.

      • setVerticalCoordinateTransform

        public void setVerticalCoordinateTransform(IVerticalCoordinateTransform verticalTransform)
        Sets the vertical coordinate transform to be used when reading the file (if any).
        Parameters:
        verticalTransform - a valid instance if a transform is to be applies; a null reference if no transform is required.

      • setDbfFieldForZ

        public void setDbfFieldForZ(String dbfFieldForZ)
        Sets the name of the field in the DBF file to use as a source for Z coordinates for data.
        Parameters:
        dbfFieldForZ - a valid string, or a null to use the Z coordinates from the Shapefile geometry file (the 0shp file).

      • setDbfFieldForAppData

        public void setDbfFieldForAppData(String dbfFieldForAppData)
        Sets the name of the field in the DBF file to use as a source for application data when creating constraints.
        Parameters:
        dbfFieldForAppData - a valid string, or a null to use the the Shapefile record number as the application data.
